content:
That's fantastic! It's wonderful to see how museums can spark a desire to learn more and explore new interests. Reading about the topics you've learned about in museums is a great way to deepen your understanding and retain the knowledge.

Regarding classes or workshops, many museums do offer educational programs, including classes, workshops, and lectures, that cater to various interests and skill levels. These programs can range from introductory courses to more advanced classes, and may be led by museum curators, educators, or experts in the field.

Museums often offer classes or workshops that are related to their current or upcoming exhibits, so it's possible that the Contemporary Art Museum might offer photography classes or workshops that tie in with the photography exhibit you're interested in.

You can check the museum's website or visit their education or programs section to see what they offer. You can also contact their education department directly to inquire about upcoming programs or suggest a program idea.

Additionally, you can also look into local colleges, community centers, or online platforms that offer photography classes or workshops. Many cities also have photography clubs or Meetup groups that organize photography walks, workshops, or classes.

It's great that you're considering taking a class or workshop to learn more about photography. Not only will you gain new skills, but you'll also have the opportunity to meet like-minded people who share your interest.

Remember to also explore online resources, such as YouTube tutorials, podcasts, and photography blogs, which can provide valuable tips and inspiration to help you improve your photography skills.
